acceptance_criteria: Subscription history displayed in chronological order

tasks.title: Create useProducts hook for product CRUD operations

tasks.title: Build Product detail view page

tasks.title: Create useReferrals hook to fetch referral data

tasks.title: Add network status indicator

tasks.title: Implement notification preferences storage

tasks.title: Submit APK to Google Play Store for production release

tasks.title: Create post-launch monitoring dashboard
tasks.description: Set up monitoring for app crashes, API errors, performance metrics, user analytics, configure alerts for critical issues

team_roles.frontend: React/TypeScript developer responsible for UI components, pages, state management, and user interactions
team_roles.backend: Backend developer responsible for Supabase integration, API hooks, data fetching, and business logic
team_roles.mobile: Mobile developer responsible for Capacitor configuration, native plugin integration, and APK build process
team_roles.devops: DevOps engineer responsible for build pipeline, deployment, environment configuration, and infrastructure
team_roles.qa: Quality assurance engineer responsible for testing, bug reporting, device testing, and quality validation
team_roles.security: Security engineer responsible for security audits, vulnerability assessment, and compliance verification
team_roles.product: Product manager responsible for documentation, user guides, store listing, and product requirements

notes: Tasks are organized into 7 sprints for phased development
Dependencies are clearly marked to ensure proper task sequencing
Estimate hours are realistic and include buffer for unknowns
Critical path: Authentication  Products  Referrals  APK Build  Testing
Parallel work possible on UI components and backend integration
QA testing integrated throughout development, not just at end
Regular testing on physical devices recommended from Sprint 3 onwards
Security review required before production deployment (TASK-070)
Documentation should be updated continuously, not just at end
